provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from making any false or misleading representations in connection with the advertising, promotion, or sale of goods or services, including specific misrepresentations about credit card affiliation, guaranteed credit, and discounted products.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unauthorized Billing
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from causing a consumer's credit or debit card to be charged or bank account to be debited without express authorization, before receipt of product information, before expiration of any free trial, after a cancellation request, or after the consumer is denied the ability to cancel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance with the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained and enjoined from violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, including by inducing consumers to divulge personal financial information through misrepresentations about bank or credit card affiliation or possession of account information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance with the Telemarketing Sales Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained and enjoined from violating the Telemarketing Sales Rule, including prohibitions against false statements to induce payment, advance fee collection for credit cards, misrepresentation of refund and cancellation policies, and failure to disclose the purpose of calls.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress Payment
provisions.summary: Defendants are jointly and severally liable for $512,000 in redress, satisfied by a $294,000 payment already deposited with the Commission and a $218,000 receivable assigned to the Commission; individual defendants must also provide taxpayer identifying numbers and driver's license copies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Commission's Use of Funds
provisions.summary: Funds paid to the Commission may be deposited into a fund for equitable relief including consumer redress; any remaining funds may be used for other equitable relief reasonably related to Defendants' practices or deposited to the U.S. Treasury as disgorgement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of the Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The freeze of Defendants' assets pursuant to the Preliminary Injunction Order entered February 4, 2003 shall be lifted to the extent necessary to turn over assets required by Paragraph V, and upon completion of that transfer shall be permanently vacated and lifted.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of this Order and a summary of its injunctive provisions to all principals, officers, employees, agents, and independent contractors, and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days from current personnel and before new personnel begin duties.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Individual Defendants must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment status, and name within 10 days; all Defendants must notify of structural changes to business entities at least 30 days prior; and all Defendants must file annual written compliance reports for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Sales Personnel
provisions.summary: In connection with any business Defendants manage, control, or have a majority ownership interest in, Defendants are restrained from failing to take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure employee and contractor compliance with the Order, including random blind testing, complaint procedures, and corrective action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Record-Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry, Defendants are restrained from failing to create and retain specified business records, including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, sales scripts and marketing materials, and all documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Access to Business Premises
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Defendants must permit Commission representatives to access any office or facility storing business documents within three business days of written notice, and must allow inspection, copying, and temporary removal of documents for up to three business days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Commission's Authority to Monitor Compliance
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor compliance through multiple means, including requiring Defendants to submit additional written reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, conduct discovery, and pose as consumers or suppliers; Defendants must permit interviews of personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibitions Involving Consumer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or disclosing any consumer identifying information obtained prior to entry of this Order in connection with goods or services marketed by Defendant Assail, Inc., except as required by law or to law enforcement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party to this Order agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Complete Settlement
provisions.summary: The parties consent to entry of this Order as a final judgment and order constituting a full, complete, and final settlement of this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating Safeguards and Privacy Rules
provisions.summary: Respondent must not violate any provision of the GLB Act's Safeguards Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314) or Privacy Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 313), directly or through any subsidiary, division, website, or other device.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Third-Party Security Assessment
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain biennial independent third-party assessments of its information security program, certifying that safeguards comply with the Safeguards Rule and adequately protect nonpublic personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and supervisory employees within 30 days of service (current) or assumption of responsibilities (future).
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days after service of the order, and at other times as required, detailing how it has complied; the initial report must include the first biennial Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on January 3, 2025, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging a violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313

provisions.title: Ban on Sale of Customer Phone Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from obtaining, marketing, or selling customer phone records and consumer personal information derived from customer phone records, except as authorized by law, regulation, or lawful court order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities

provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.summary: Judgment of $40,075.00 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally, suspended upon payment of $3,000.00 within 5 days; funds are to be used for equitable relief, and Defendants must furnish tax identification numbers to the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Reopen
provisions.summary: If the Court finds that either Defendant materially misrepresented or omitted assets in their financial statements, the suspended judgment becomes immediately due and payable; Defendants waive the right to contest complaint allegations for purposes of this section.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

Kacala must cooperate in good faith with the FTC, appear at requested places and times for interviews, discovery, and document review, and provide truthful testimony in any trial or proceeding related to the complaint without a subpoena if requested in writing.

provisions.title: Employment Change Notification — John D. Eubank
provisions.summary: Respondent John D. Eubank must notify the FTC for 10 years of any discontinuance of current business or employment, or any affiliation with new business or employment, including new address, phone number, and description of duties.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1), and Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Corporate Change Notification
provisions.summary: Respondents must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any corporate change (dissolution, merger, sale, name change, bankruptcy filing, etc.) that may affect compliance obligations under this order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1), and Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondents must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 180 days of service of the order, and at such other times as the FTC may require, including a copy of the initial Assessment from Part II.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1), and Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on April 12, 2025, or 20 years from the most recent date the FTC or United States files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of the order, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)(1), and Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy and Security
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, or integrity of personal information collected from or about consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive information security program reasonably designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of personal information, including specific administrative, technical, and physical safeguards.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Compliance with Gramm-Leach-Bliley Rules
provisions.summary: Respondent must not violate the FTC's Safeguards Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 314) or the Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule (16 C.F.R. Part 313), with a safe harbor if either rule is later amended.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Biennial Third-Party Security Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party security assessments from a qualified independent professional covering compliance with Parts II and III.A, with the initial assessment covering the first 180 days and biennial assessments for each two-year period thereafter for ten years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC documents relating to compliance, including documents contradicting compliance for five years and assessment-related materials for three years after each assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Order Distribution and Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to any change in the company that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days after service of this order, and at such other times as the FTC may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on April 9, 2028, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging a violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314; Privacy of Customer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; Title V, Subtitle A of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801-6809

provisions.title: Prohibited Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent any material restriction or condition to use any Payment and Social Networking Service, or the extent to which it protects the privacy, confidentiality, security, or integrity of covered information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Required Disclosures
provisions.summary: Within 150 days, Respondent must clearly and conspicuously disclose, near any representation about fund transfers, that transactions are subject to review and funds may be frozen; and must issue a notice to all Users about transaction review practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Additional Privacy Disclosures
provisions.summary: Within 150 days and continuing thereafter, Respondent must clearly and conspicuously disclose to each User how their transaction information will be shared and how they can use privacy settings to limit such sharing, at the time of their next transaction or account opening.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: GLB Rule Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Regulation P) and the Standards for Safeguarding Consumer Information Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Biennial Assessment Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial third-party assessments of the Venmo Payment and Social Networking Service covering administrative, technical, and physical safeguards, with the initial assessment covering the first 180 days and biennial assessments covering each two-year period for 10 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all principals, officers, employees, and new personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 60 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the issuance date, and must submit sworn notices within 14 days of any changes in points of contact, organizational structure, or bankruptcy filings.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 20 years after the issuance date, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, advertising materials, and assessment materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using all other lawful investigative means including undercover contacts.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule (Reg. P), 16 C.F.R. Part 313; and the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from misrepresenting, expressly or by implication, the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy, security, confidentiality, or integrity of any Personal Information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Mandated Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Defendant must establish, implement, and maintain for twenty years a comprehensive information security program designed to protect the security, confidentiality, and integrity of Personal Information, meeting detailed minimum requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Information Security Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain initial and biennial third-party information security assessments from a qualified, independent assessor covering the first 180 days and each two-year period thereafter for twenty years, with assessments submitted to the FTC within ten days of completion.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third Party Information Security Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must not withhold material facts from or misrepresent any material fact to the Assessor, and must provide the Assessor full access to its network, IT assets, and all relevant information and materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide annual certifications to the Commission for twenty years from a board-level or senior officer attesting to compliance with the Order, absence of material noncompliance, cooperation with the Assessor, and describing any Covered Incidents.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: For twenty years, Defendant must report Covered Incidents to the Commission no later than ten days after first notifying any government entity, with detailed information about the incident, and provide quarterly summaries to its board.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Additional Monetary Obligations
provisions.summary: A monetary judgment of $425,000,000 is entered against Defendant, with additional financial obligations triggered if more than seven million Affected Consumers enroll in the Product, calculated using specified formulas during both the Initial and Extended Claims Periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Consumer Restitution and Redress Through Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: Consumer relief may be conducted through the Multi-District Litigation Settlement rather than directly by the Commission, with Defendant required to deposit $300,000,000 into the Consumer Fund in specified tranches and up to an additional $125,000,000 if needed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Consumer Fund for Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: At least $300,000,000 (plus any additional deposits) in the Consumer Fund must be used exclusively to provide restitution and redress to Affected Consumers through specified categories of relief including credit monitoring, out-of-pocket loss reimbursement, identity restoration services, and administrative costs.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Notice and Claims in Multi-District Litigation
provisions.summary: If Defendant deposits money into the Consumer Fund, it must supply information to the Notice Provider and Settlement Administrator, notify the Commission of any modifications, provide weekly and annual reports to the Commission, and cooperate fully in claims administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Reversion of Consumer Relief to Administration by Commission
provisions.summary: The Commission may end its forbearance and collect the monetary judgment directly upon written notice of specified Termination Events, at which point Defendant must make direct payments to the Commission within twenty-one days and continue to cooperate in consumer relief administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to assets transferred under this Order, facts in the Complaint are deemed true for enforcement proceedings, and all money paid to the Commission will be used for consumer relief consistent with Section IX.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Single-Bureau Monitoring and Identity Theft Protection
provisions.summary: Defendant must offer single-bureau credit monitoring to Affected Consumers upon expiration of the Product (up to ten years aggregate), additional years for minors (up to eighteen years aggregate), free security freezes for ten years, and six free Personal Consumer Reports per year for seven years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Prohibition on Advertising or Marketing to Consumers Who Use Identity Theft Protection Services
provisions.summary: Defendant must not use information provided by Affected Consumers through the Order's identity theft protection services to sell, upsell, cross-sell, or market its products or services unless it makes a Clear and Conspicuous disclosure and obtains affirmative express consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Additional Notice
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide specific notices to Affected Consumers and the general public, including website hyperlinks, press releases, and social media posts directing consumers to the Settlement Website, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Rule Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained and enjoined from violating any provision of the Standards for Safeguarding Consumer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within seven days, deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managerial employees, and affected business entities for ten years, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit an annual compliance report one year after entry of the Order, notify the Commission within 14 days of any changes to designated contacts or entity structure for 20 years, and notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, information security assessments, representations about data security, and all materials related to Assessments.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission has broad authority to monitor Defendant's compliance, including obtaining additional compliance reports, conducting depositions and discovery, communicating directly with Defendant, interviewing employees, and using undercover means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Severability
provisions.summary: If any clause, provision, or section of the Order is held illegal, invalid, or unenforceable, the remaining provisions remain in full force and effect.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Sections 501-504 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6801-6804

provisions.title: Comprehensive Information Security Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written information security program with administrative, technical, and physical safeguards appropriate to its size and the sensitivity of personal information it handles.

provisions.summary: The Commission may monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports and records, interviewing affiliated personnel, and using undercover means, without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates and Duration
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates on October 20, 2037, or 20 years from the most recent federal court complaint alleging any violation, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); the Privacy of Consumer Financial Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 313; the Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314

provisions.title: Bond Requirements for Unsolicited Commercial E-mail
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from sending Unsolicited Commercial E-mail unless he first obtains a $1,000,000 performance bond, subject to specific terms regarding duration, surety, notice, and disclosure.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from making any false or misleading express or implied misrepresentation or material omission in connection with Internet-advertised goods/services or residential mortgages, including mortgage terms, lender status, website security, and personal financial information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against TILA and Regulation Z Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating TILA and/or Regulation Z in connection with any advertisement promoting consumer credit extensions, including advertising inaccurate credit terms, rates, payment rates, or repayment periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violations of Subtitle A of Title V of the GLB Act
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating or assisting others in violating Subtitle A of Title V of the GLB Act or the Privacy Rule, including failing to provide required privacy/opt-out notices, improper disclosure of nonpublic personal information, and prohibited reuse or redisclosure of such information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violations of Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating or assisting others in violating Subtitle B of Title V of the GLB Act, including obtaining or attempting to obtain customer information of a financial institution through false, fictitious, or fraudulent statements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, business inspections, discovery, undercover posing as consumers or suppliers, and interviews of personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment, name, and corporate structure; and must submit a sworn written compliance report 180 days after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, Defendant must create and retain accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints/refund requests, and all sales/marketing materials for any qualifying business he owns or controls.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to relevant employees, principals, officers, directors, and managers of qualifying businesses and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receiving it.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Sales Personnel
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from failing to take reasonable steps to monitor sales personnel compliance, failing to investigate consumer complaints, and failing to take corrective action against non-compliant salespersons.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Prohibitions Involving Consumer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from selling, renting, transferring, or otherwise disclosing personal identifying information of any person who submitted information to 30 Minute Mortgage Inc., and from benefiting from or using such information obtained as a result of the activities alleged in the complaint.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.summary: The Court orders immediate entry of this judgment by the Clerk, finding no just reason for delay.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 108(c) of the Truth in Lending Act (TILA), 15 U.S.C. § 1607(c); and Sections 505(a)(7) and 522(a) of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6805(a)(7) & 6822(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Security and Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which consumer personal information submitted through its websites is protected by SSL encryption, or the extent to which respondent maintains and protects the privacy, confidentiality, or security of personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Violating the GLB Safeguards Rule
provisions.summary: Respondent must not violate any provision of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act's Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule (Safeguards Rule), 16 C.F.R. Part 314.

provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain biennial third-party security assessments from a qualified independent professional within 180 days of service and every two years thereafter for ten years, covering implemented safeguards, their appropriateness, compliance with the Safeguards Rule, and certification of program effectiveness.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees with supervisory responsibilities, within 30 days of service for current personnel and within 30 days of assuming a position for future personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days before any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes; if notice is not possible 30 days in advance, notification must be as soon as practicable.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order terminates on December 14, 2025, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation of the order is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Standards for Safeguarding Customer Information Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 314, issued pursuant to Title V of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6801 et seq.
